title: Hilary Duff Says Her Forthcoming Music Is Dedicated to Her Queer Fans: â€˜I Just Want to ImpressÂ Themâ€™
summary: The singer also teased that the music was coming "in the blink of an eye."
body: As a longtime ally for the LGBTQ+ community, Hilary Duff knows how important her new music is for her queer fan base. Related Hilary Duff Is Returning to Music: New Label Deal Announced, Docuseries in the Works Ariana Grande Belts Out This Classic Disney Channel Hit While Doing Her Makeup, Because ‘Why Not?’ ‘SNL’ Host Mikey Madison & Bowen Yang Bond Over Hilary Duff’s Viral ‘Today’ Show Dance From 2007 In an interview with Variety published on Monday (Oct. 27), Duff spoke about her upcoming return to music after the announcement that she had signed to Atlantic Records in September. During the conversation, the Lizzie McGuire star was asked about the excitement from her gay fans about the forthcoming release, and Duff gave a simple, clear answer: “You know itâ€™s all for them. Itâ€™s just to impress them.” Duff has long been a vocal supporter of the LGBTQ+ community. In a 2022 interview for her starring role on the Hulu sitcom How I Met Your Father, Duff said she felt that “I owe the community everything,” particularly because “that particular community is just so vocal for my career.” Butâ€¦

title: Kneecap, Scissor Sisters, Skrillex & Four Tet to Headline 2026 BoomtownÂ Festival
summary: The event will return to Hampshire's Matterley Estate next summer.
body: Hampshireâ€™s Boomtown Festival has unveiled its lineup for 2026â€™s event, featuring names from all across the musical spectrum. Next yearâ€™s edition will take place at the Matterley Estate in the south of England on Aug. 12-16. Since its inception in 2009, the festival has annually built itself around an overarching “Chapter” that plays out via themed on-site installations, with next yearâ€™s theme being “Chapter 5: Radical Redesign.” Kneecap, Scissor Sisters, Skrillex, Four Tet, Ashnikko, Faithless, Scooter and Shaggy lead the way among the first names announced for 2026, alongside ska icons Madness and rapper Eve. Joining them on the lineup will be Antony Szmierek, Bad Manners, Big Special, Brutalismus 3000, Groove Armada, High Vis, Princess Nokia, Sampa the Great, Shy FX, Skindred, Vengaboys, Wilkinson and more. Public transport tickets go on sale via Boomtownâ€™s official website on Oct. 30, with general entry tickets going live the following day. More announcements are set to be made about the lineup and across the festivalâ€™s theater and immersive art offerings. Previous performers at the event have included Maribou State, Overmono, The Prodigy, Peaches, Goriâ€¦

title: Tina Knowles Reveals BeyoncÃ© & Solange Sang Her This Song Right Before Breast CancerÂ Surgery
summary: "I went in there laughing and feeling so blessed â€” like everything was going to be OK," she recalled.
body: Right before undergoing surgery, Tina Knowles got a live serenade from her two favorite singers: BeyoncÃ© and Solange . Related Tina Knowles Reveals Breast Cancer Battle & How BeyoncÃ©, Solange ‘Became My Team’ After Diagnosis Tina Knowles Thanks BeyoncÃ© & Solange While Accepting Mother of the Year Award at Billboard Women in Music 2025 BeyoncÃ© Brings Tina Knowles on Stage & Asks Crowd to Congratulate Her at Cowboy Carter Tour While speaking to People on Monday (Oct. 27) at the 27th Annual Angel Ball in New York City, the designer recalled the sweet way her two daughters cheered her up just before she had her procedure late last year to remove a tumor in her left breast. “Right before I was wheeled in to get the surgery, my girls sang a gospel song,” Knowles shared. The mogul went on to reveal that the tune her two girls sang was called “Walk With Me,” which “I absolutely love,” Knowles said. Bey and Solange also had their mom going into surgery in good spirits by showing her the highly quotable viral video of TikToker Jools Lebron reminding followers to always be “very demure, very mindful.” &#82â€¦

title: The Best 2025 Halloween Costumes From Megan Thee Stallion, Chloe Bailey, Kane Brown, Victoria Justice & MoreÂ (Updating)
summary: Here's a roundup of the best 2025 celebrity Halloween costumes.
body: With Halloween falling on a Friday this year, it looks like we’re getting two full weekends of Halloween celebration. Things kicked off last week, with Victoria Justice hosting her “Love Zombie” Halloween & Single Release Party in Los Angeles and embodying her new song by dressing up as the titular undead character. Bette Midler ‘s New York Restoration Project Hulaween Gala hit New York City over the weekend, and Midler hit the red carpet dressed as her own Divine Miss M persona next to Andy Cohen as Andy Warhol. Other celebs at Midler’s party: Ben Platt and husband Noah Galvin as Hugh Hefner and a Playboy Playmate, Darren Criss and wife Mia Criss as New York clowns, and Michael Kors and husband Lance LePere as taxi drivers. Related The 25 Biggest Halloween Songs of All Time on the Hot 100 But some stars didn’t need a party to get dolled up. Paris Hilton took to Instagram to show off her “Oops… I Did It Again!”-era Britney Spears costume , complete with red latex bodysuit. “Oops, I did it again … Starting off #Halloweek by honoring my Queen @BritneySpears,” Hilton captured the series of photos and vidâ€¦

title: OPPO Find X9 Pro goes global: A dream phone with 7,500mAh battery, detachable 10x lens
summary: Looking for a great camera phone? Then you should keep your eye on the Find X9 series.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o5NkeYWXjZM TL;DR OPPO has launched the Find X9 and Find X9 Pro smartphones in global markets. The phones offer a Dimensity 9500 flagship processor, huge batteries, and flexible rear cameras. The Find X9 Pro in particular has a 200MP telephoto camera that can be paired with an external lens for 10x native zoom. The OPPO Find X8 Pro was one of the best Android phones in global markets, owing to its large battery, great dual tele cameras, and extensive list of general features. Now, the company has released the Find X9 series outside China, and these look like an Android userâ€™s dream phones. The two phones share a MediaTek Dimensity 9500 flagship SoC, 80W wired and 50W wireless charging, and an ultrasonic fingerprint scanner in lieu of last yearâ€™s optical scanner. The two phones also ditch the alert slider in favor of a so-called Snap Key. This is a customizable shortcut button thatâ€™s mapped to the AI Mind Space feature by default. Otherwise, both phones have matte glass backs and metal frames with IP68/69 ratings.

title: LeAnn Rimes On Her Three-Decade Touring Career: â€˜Pretty Much Nothing Embarrasses MeÂ Onstageâ€™
summary: Famous since she was a kid, the country singer remains a captivating presence on the road.
body: After touring for 30 years, LeAnn Rimes has learned a thing or two about maintaining her Â­sanity on the road. â€œDonâ€™t ever fly day of show. You canâ€™t do that anymore,â€ she cautions. â€œEven if youâ€™re flying from Los Angeles to Oakland [Calif.], make sure you pack your outfit in your carry-on because your bag still may get f–king lost. And never do more than three shows in a row.â€ Rimes has been famous ever since an impossibly big voice came out of a wee girl when she appeared on Star Search in 1991, becoming a one-week champion at the age of 8. Five years later, she sounded preternaturally mature when Curb Records released her first single, â€œBlue,â€ which garnered comparisons to Patsy Cline. More than three decades into her career, the multiple Grammy winner, now 43, finds touring a richer experience than ever before, which has earned her the Unstoppable Award, to be presented at the Billboard Live Music Summit in Los Angeles on Nov. 3. â€œI love performing now more than I probably ever have because I feel like itâ€™s on my terms,â€ she says. â€œI create this show that I want to perform, and I invite people into this space.â€ LeAnn Rimes will be honored with the Unstoppable Award aâ€¦

title: Meet Larissa Lambert, the Billboard R&B Rookie of the Month Who Justin Bieber and SZA Canâ€™t Get EnoughÂ Of
summary: Australian singer-songwriter Larissa Lambert went viral with her classic R&B covers, and now is drawing attention with her own Chronosick EP.
body: The idea of moving to America constantly tugs at rising singer-songwriter Larissa Lambert. The Aussie songbirdâ€™s honeyed vocals and candor-laced lyrics have already caught the attention of musicâ€™s top heavyweights â€” from Justin Bieber to SZA â€” whoâ€™ve praised her limitless potential. With a growing U.S. fan base and a deep reverence for nostalgic R&B, Lambert is beginning to outgrow life Down Under and seriously consider a new area code. â€œI do think at some point I’m going to have to move there,â€ she says matter-of-factly over Zoom earlier this month. â€œAustralia is always home and itâ€™s good for my mentality â€” it keeps me grounded. Home is always going to feel better, but the U.S. is just a different level. It’s a different level when it comes to creating.â€ With R&B surging in the States â€” thanks to Leon Thomas, Kehlani and Rayvn Lenae landing Top 15 hits on the Hot 100 in 2025 â€” Lambert is captivated by the idea of finding her place among the genreâ€™s elite. â€œYou have some of the most talented songwriters, producers and artists in the U.S.,â€ she adds. â€œTo create in Australia is just not the same as creating in America, especially with how quickly you can get bodiâ€¦

title: â€˜Monsta X: Connect X In Cinemasâ€™ Live Movie Slated to Hit Screens Across the Globe Later ThisÂ Year
summary: The concert film was shot over three nights in July at the KSPO Dome in Seoul.
body: K-pop group Monsta X will beam into movie theaters around the globe on Dec. 3 with the concert movie Monsta X: Connect X in Cinemas . The live concert film shot over three nights in July of this year during the group’s run of gigs at the KSPO Dome in Seoul, South Korea will also screen on Dec. 7 in a limited run. Related Monsta X Isn’t Worried About â€˜Lost Timeâ€™ â€” Just Continuing to Raise the Bar After More Than a Decade Duran Duran Gear Up For Halloween With Fan Favorite Re-Recording The Final Edition of Friendship Is Happening in 2026: See The Lineup The movie also serves as a tribute to the decade-long journey shared by members Joohoney, I.M., Hyungwon, Kihyun, Minhyuk and Shownu with their fandom, known as MONBEBE. The movie, brought to screens by Trafalgar Releasing and CJ4DPLEX, will be shown on regular screens, as well as the latter’s specialized formats: SCREENX, 4DX AND ULTRA 4DX. Tickets for the movie and venue information for all participating territories will be available beginning on Nov. 4 at 9 a.m. ET here . According to a release, the movie celebrates the group’s decade-long rise with, “exclusive, never-before-seen content, featuriâ€¦

title: Older Pixel phones have a major weakness when it comes to UWB tracking
summary: The Pixel 6 Pro and Pixel 7 Pro are seemingly incompatible with Find Hubâ€™s precision finding feature despite having UWB.
body: TL;DR The Moto Tagâ€™s UWB precision finding doesnâ€™t work on the Pixel 6 Pro and 7 Pro, even though both phones have the necessary UWB hardware. A Google support page confirms the feature is only available on the Pixel 8 Pro and newer, leaving out owners of older UWB-equipped Pixels. The exact technical reason for this incompatibility is unclear, as the hardware specifications for the older models donâ€™t fully explain the omission. Choosing the right Bluetooth tracker can be challenging, but if you want to take advantage of your Android phoneâ€™s UWB hardware for precision finding, the choice is simple: the Moto Tag. Itâ€™s currently the only UWB-equipped tracker that works with Android, allowing you to precisely pinpoint its location from the Find Hub app. However, since most Android phones lack UWB, very few devices can use the Moto Tagâ€™s best feature. The technology is only available on select devices in Motorolaâ€™s Edge and Razr lines, Samsungâ€™s flagship Galaxy S and Z series, and Googleâ€™s Pixel phones.

title: Florence Road on Gigging With Olivia Rodrigo, Wolf Alice: â€˜Weâ€™re Soaking Up EveryÂ Secondâ€™
summary: The Irish indie rockers' thrilling live show has made them one of 2025's biggest breakthrough acts.
body: â€œThrow spaghetti at the wall and see what sticks,â€ says bassist Ailbhe Barry, and for her band Florence Road , it is a kind of mission statement â€“ one that their steep, uninhibited rise has borne out. To scroll the Irish indie rockersâ€™ TikTok or Instagram from the bottom up is to witness this experiment in all its mess and world-building rawness, having spent years honing their own unpolished garage band persona online instead of jumping on forced trends.  The quartet, who are all in their early 20s, possess a confidence and adventurous spirit that belies their infancy as a unit. Like their Gen Z age-mates, the members of Florence Road favour a 0.5 (or extra-wide) lens on their iPhone cameras for its distorted or less â€˜choreographedâ€™ feel; using this visual gimmick on their live performance videos has routinely brought the bandâ€™s music to the For You Pages of millions, while keeping the focus on their grungy, gloriously anthemic sound.  Theyâ€™ve covered pop heroes Chappell Roan and Sabrina Carpenter , and caught the attention of Olivia Rodrigo with their pared-back rendition of â€œObsessed,â€ leading to support slots at Dublinâ€™s Marlay Park and BST Hyde Park in London over tâ€¦

title: Watch Fergie Deliver a Rare Performance as Ludacrisâ€™ Surprise Guest at OneÂ Musicfest
summary: Jermaine Dupri, Jadakiss, Jeezy, Usher and LL Cool J also made appearances during Luda's set.
body: Fergie made her return to the stage in what Ludacris called her first performance in seven years when she appeared a special guest during his star-studded set at One Musicfest in Atlanta on Sunday night (Oct. 26). â€œWe got Fergie out the muthafâ€”king house! Can yâ€™all please make some noise?” Luda asked the raucous crowd. “She ainâ€™t perform in over seven years and she came to Atlanta, Ga.!” Fergie popped out through a riser in a denim bottom and furry jacket as she performed her “Glamorous” smash with Luda, which topped the Billboard Hot 100 back in 2007. “They ainâ€™t ready for this,” she teased, before leading into her “London Bridge (Oh Shit)” anthem, which saw the Hot 100 No. 1 hit’s producer, Polow Da Don, join her on stage to assist with ad-libs. Fergie then gave Luda his flowers. “Thank you so much for being here for me every single time,” she said. “Everyone give it up for Luda!” We told yâ€™all history would be made at #OMF2025 ! ğŸ™ŒğŸ½ @Ludacris brought out the one and only @Fergie for his 25th anniversary at #ONEMusicfest ! ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ pic.twitter.com/zGeyTfEs52 — ONE Musicfest (@onemusicfest) Oâ€¦

title: Pixel 10a is looking kind of familiar in these leaked renders
summary: Donâ€™t expect big design changes on the Pixel 10a.
body: Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR CAD renders of the Pixel 10a have leaked. The renders suggest that the phone will adopt a similar design to the Pixel 9a. The Pixel 10a could use a higher clocked version of the Tensor G4. With the Pixel 10 series now out, our focus shifts to Googleâ€™s next budget phone. At the moment, thereâ€™s not a whole lot of information available about the Pixel 10a . However, a new leak is now giving us a little something to chew on. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: The next Snapdragon flagship SoC could be good news for Android phones, bad news for your wallet
summary: We could get even better performance and efficiency, but at an even higher cost.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR A new leak claims that the upcoming Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 6 SoC by Qualcomm will utilize TSMCâ€™s advanced N2P chip process for improved performance and efficiency. It is expected to support LPDDR6 RAM and UFS 5.0 storage, offering significant enhancements over the current 8 Elite Gen 5 SoC. However, continued increases in manufacturing costs may make next-gen flagship phones with this future chip notably pricier. Qualcommâ€™s newest Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 is the SoC of choice for many next-generation Android flagships . Itâ€™s the latest and greatest chip on the block, announced just a few weeks ago. The cycle for new phones has just gotten started with this new SoC, but weâ€™re already seeing leaks appear for its successor, the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 6. Thereâ€™s good news and then thereâ€™s bad news, so letâ€™s start with the good news. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Retroidâ€™s latest gaming handhelds are now for sale: Hereâ€™s which one to buy
summary: They might look similar, but there's a lot to consider before buying.
body: Credit: Retroid TL;DR The Retroid Pocket G2 and Pocket 6 are now available for sale. Early bird prices start at $199 for the Pocket G2 and $209 for the Pocket 6. The Pocket G2 ships this week, while the more powerful Pocket 6 wonâ€™t ship until January Retroid just announced its new lineup of handhelds yesterday, and we didnâ€™t have to wait long to buy them. Whereas companies like AYANEO and AYN tease handhelds for weeks or even months before they go to market, the Retroid Pocket G2 and Pocket 6 are already up for sale on the official website. That said, only one is truly close to shipping, and thatâ€™s the Pocket G2. As the name implies, itâ€™s the first Android gaming handheld with Qualcommâ€™s mid-range Snapdragon G2 Gen 2 processor, which should be significantly more powerful than the Snapdragon 865 on the Pocket 5. We were very impressed with the performance on the cheaper G1 Gen 2 SoC found on the Retroid Pocket Classic , but stay tuned for full G2 Gen 2 testing in the coming weeks.

title: Best finisher? Toughest opponent? - Shearer answers your questions
summary: Alan Shearer answers questions from the BBC Sport audience (and Dion Dublin) on Football Focus at Newcastle's St James' Park.

title: I tried out the top AI news apps and these 5 actually improve your news feed
summary: Get a summarized take from all sides of the debate.
body: AI-generated news might not be everyoneâ€™s cup of tea, but it certainly has its advantages. Itâ€™s particularly useful if youâ€™re concerned about the bias of traditional news outlets, as the summaries are generated by collating and analyzing the same story from across the political spectrum. It might not have the human touch, but it can do the legwork of 100 journalists at once when it comes to gathering every perspective and combining them to give you a balanced take. These types of apps are an emerging market, and their quality is still hit-or-miss. Even Gemini struggles in this pursuit . title: YouTube now has fun â€˜likeâ€™ button animations, and here are all 20 of them
summary: From cats to cricket, YouTube's new custom like button animations are delighting users.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube has introduced new custom like button animations that change based on the genre of content. These animations appear in videos with themes such as music, film, animals, sports, and more. YouTube recently rolled out its new UI for web, mobile, and TV. While the changes are driving some people up the wall , some smaller elements are receiving positive feedback. For instance, YouTube now has custom like button animations for specific genres of videos, and users are delighted to find these scattered around the platform like easter eggs. If youâ€™re curious what all of these are, and donâ€™t mind the spoilers, here are all the new like button animations. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: No more ad-filled Android games; this is why I gave my husband the gift of emulation
summary: The Retroid Pocket Classic is perfect for an 80s kid who grew up with Game Boys; he just didn't know it existed.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority My husband and I donâ€™t have a habit of gifting each other on birthdays or holidays. We did that for a bit the first year or two, then fell into a rhythm of choosing what we wanted together, be it valuable purchases, trips, or experiences. But a few months ago, as his birthday was approaching, I decided to break this unspoken rule and buy him an Android gaming handheld, the Retroid Pocket Classic (). Hereâ€™s why I made that choice and why it turned out to be the most perfect and fun gift I couldâ€™ve ever given him. Why a portable gaming device seemed like the perfect gift

title: Donâ€™t trust big tech? These are the 5 offline-first apps I recommend
summary: There are plenty of others, but these should get you started.
body: Credit: Mitja Rutnik / Android Authority I generally rely on cloud services, but Iâ€™m increasingly uncomfortable with the fact that most of my data is online and possibly available for others to see. This includes my financials, photos , notes, tasks, and a lot more. With that in mind, I started researching offline-first apps. Apps that store all the data on my device, making sure Iâ€™m the only one who has access to them. Sure, this has its own set of problems. I canâ€™t access my data from multiple devices, and if my phone goes bust, everything is gone.

title: I'm just keeping Celtic seat warm - O'Neill
summary: Martin O'Neill says he had to "pull myself off the floor" when he was asked to take interim charge of Celtic following Brendan Rodgers' exit.

title: Are the OnePlus 15 cameras any good? Here are the first pictures I took
summary: Farewell, Hasselblad, I'm not sure just how much I'll miss you... yet.
body: Itâ€™s hard to believe weâ€™re already here, but itâ€™s true: The OnePlus 15 has arrived. Alright, well, itâ€™s technically only officially available in China, but we have our hands on a unit ahead of the global launch, which is comingâ€¦ soon. And, while we canâ€™t say very much about the phone or its specs just yet, we can put the cameras to the test â€” something weâ€™ve been waiting for ever since OnePlus confirmed the end of its Hasselblad partnership and the launch of the DetailMax Engine. So, letâ€™s take a look at some of the first snaps I captured with OnePlusâ€™s latest flagship.

title: Huge Switch emulator update finally improves performance on 8 Elite devices
summary: But be careful when you update, or you might lose your saves.
body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR Nintendo Switch emulator Eden just dropped a huge update, v0.0.4-rc1. It brings many changes, including better 8 Elite support, firmware 20.x compatibility, and more. When updating, be sure to back up your data to avoid losing your saves. A huge new update for the Nintendo Switch emulator Eden just dropped, and it brings a ton of changes and upgrades. The patch notes are exceptionally long on this one, but thereâ€™s some particularly exciting news for Android users. Eden v0.0.4-rc1 finally improves support for stock Qualcomm drivers, improving performance on Snapdragon 8 Elite devices. Despite the massive jump in power, 8 Elite devices have seen worse performance due to a lack of turnip drivers, but that may finally be coming to an end.

title: One UI 8.5 could let you share the secret sauce behind your great photos
summary: You'll soon be able to save your favorite Pro camera settings as a preset and share it with other Galaxy users.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Code within leaked One UI 8.5 builds suggests Samsung will introduce camera presets for Pro mode. The presets will allow users to save and quickly apply custom settings, such as ISO, shutter speed, and white balance. There are also clues that users will be able to share these camera presets with other Galaxy users via Quick Share. One UI 8.5â€™s release timeline might be up in the air, but that doesnâ€™t take away from the fact that itâ€™s one of the bigger updates to arrive on Samsung Galaxy phones and tablets . Leaks have revealed numerous new features and improvements reportedly coming with One UI 8.5, and the latest code sightings within leaked One UI 8.5 builds bring great news for Pro camera fans. title: 5 apps you should use instead of Duolingo
summary: The owl isn't the only option when it comes to language learning.
body: After Duolingo introduced its controversial new energy system for free users of the app, I decided it was finally time to quit Duolingo once and for all. I had been dissatisfied with the app for a while, despite racking up a long streak and getting stuck on a specific genre of lessons. Iâ€™ve spent a long time trying out alternatives to the language-learning app, with my efforts intensifying after I left it behind. After trying out plenty of options, here are the five best Duolingo alternatives that stand out from the rest.

title: Poll: Do you care about Amazon Kindle updates?
summary: From delightful upgrades to workflow disruptions, software updates can deliver a range of changes.
body: I love a good surprise, like finding a $20 bill in last yearâ€™s jacket. Kindle updates are not always that. Despite their lack of fanfare, they can drastically reshape usersâ€™ reading experiences, sometimes for the better and sometimes not. As often as the updates deliver new features, they also bring bugs, break habits, and frustrate jailbreakers whoâ€™d rather stay frozen in time. A few recent Kindle updates have genuinely earned my applause. Amazon gave us finer text controls with adjustable line and paragraph spacing that make reading feel less claustrophobic. Likewise, accessibility tweaks improved navigation for visually impaired users. A recent Kindle Scribe update delivered new pen tools and a sleeker sidebar for note-taking.

title: Pixel Camera finally works again on GrapheneOS â€” and no downgrade is needed
summary: You can either install this app, or wait for the next update for an integrated fix.
body: Credit: Calvin Wankhede / Android Authority TL;DR A missing font was causing the Pixel Camera app to crash on de-Googleâ€™ed operating systems, such as GrapheneOS. Users had to downgrade to an older release of the camera app to use it again. To fix the issue, users on GrapheneOS build v2025102300 and older can install the GmsCompatLib app v100 from the GrapheneOS store. A future GrapheneOS build (v2025102600) will include the Pixel Camera app fix natively, eliminating the need for extra installation. Last week, the Pixel Camera app began crashing on de-Googled aftermarket OS solutions, such as GrapheneOS. If users didnâ€™t have Google Play Services on their device, the Pixel Camera app would either crash or refuse to start. As it turns out, the actual issue was a missing font . Users could roll back to older versions of the Pixel Camera app, but now, the fix is here for GrapheneOS users. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

summary: The Galaxy Z Fold 8 could fix where the Z Fold 7 went wrong.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR A Korean outlet has claimed that the Galaxy Z Fold 8 could have a battery larger than 5,000mAh. This would be a dramatic and overdue increase in battery capacity for the Z Fold family. The phone is also tipped to offer S Pen support and a reduced display crease. The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 is one of the best foldable phones of 2025, and thatâ€™s largely due to its cutting-edge design. However, the Z Fold 7 retains a 4,400mAh battery for the fifth straight generation, while Samsung also nixed S Pen support. There might be good news for the Galaxy Z Fold 8, though. Dealsite (via Jukanlosreve on Twitter) reports that the Galaxy Z Fold 8 could have a battery larger than 5,000mAh. This would be much bigger than the Z Fold 7â€™s 4,400mAh battery.

title: Google starts rolling out YouTube-style age checks for Play Store
summary: Google is starting to require Play Store users to prove they are 18 or older.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google has reportedly started rolling out its new age verification requirements for the Play Store. Failure to prove you are 18 or older could lead to disruptions in app downloads. Users can verify their age for the Play Store using a government-issued ID, taking a selfie, using a credit card, or through a third-party age-estimation provider such as Verifymy.io. Google has apparently started rolling out its new Play Store age verification system , similar to the process it recently introduced on YouTube .

The update carries minor security and bug fixes. Google is now rolling out the October 2025 update for the original Pixel Watch after pushing it out earlier this month for the Pixel Watch 2 and Pixel Watch 3. As usual, the rollout of the new software will continue over the next few days.

title: GM clarifies that Android Auto will remain available â€” for now
summary: GM says the transition will happen "over time, not overnight."
body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR GM has issued a new statement regarding Android Auto and Apple CarPlay in its gas-powered vehicles. The company says both platforms will remain available for the foreseeable future. It looks like the transition away from Android Auto and CarPlay may not happen until GM is ready to roll out its centralized vehicle computing platform. As we learned last week, General Motors isnâ€™t just planning to ditch Android Auto and Apple CarPlay in its EVs. The largest automobile manufacturer in the US plans to get rid of the two platforms in its gas-powered vehicles as well. Now the company has released a new statement that reveals thereâ€™s still plenty of time before that change happens. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: This key Samsung Galaxy XR feature opens up a world of accessories
summary: The Samsung Galaxy XR headset beats Vision Pro and Quest in an unexpected way.
body: TL;DR Samsungâ€™s Galaxy XR headset has a hidden USB-C port under a cap on the right strap. The USB-C port works independently of the proprietary battery connector, so Galaxy XR can charge and use wired accessories simultaneously. Compared to Apple Vision Pro and Meta Quest headsets, Galaxy XR figures to handle wired accessories better thanks to the dedicated port. Samsung is helping to usher in the Android XR platform with its first headset, known as Galaxy XR. It appears to take design cues from competitors like Apple and Meta, but has clear advantages of its own. Aside from supporting the full Google Play Store app ecosystem , Samsungâ€™s Galaxy XR has another trick up its sleeve: a hidden, fully-featured USB-C port. The subtle connector is covered most of the time, but after removing the cap on the headsetâ€™s right strap, users will find a USB-C port on the Galaxy XR, as discovered by UploadVR . Crucially, the USB-C port is separate from the Galaxy XRâ€™s battery connector. The headsetâ€™s tethered battery connects with a proprietary pin system, opening up the USB-C port for use with other accessories.

title: GM is dropping Android Auto to make way for Gemini (Update: New statement)
summary: GM wants you to talk to your car, not your phone.
body: Credit: Adam Birney / Android Authority TL;DR GM will drop Android Auto and Apple CarPlay support as it transitions to a centralized computing platform. The automaker will integrate Googleâ€™s Gemini AI into its vehicles starting in 2026, offering a smarter, conversational assistant. Gemini will be available as an over-the-air update via the Play Store for OnStar-equipped vehicles (2015 and newer). GM will also test other AI models from firms like OpenAI and Anthropic, while keeping user data private. Update: October 25, 2025 (5:29 PM ET): A GM spokesperson has issued a new statement regarding Android Auto and Apple CarPlay availability. title: Hereâ€™s how Google might make Messages easier to use with one hand
summary: The company is working on a better way to select and share in Google Messages.
body: TL;DR Google is working on a new user interface for Messages thatâ€™ll swap the hamburger menu for a context menu. The updated context menu will centralize buttons for sharing and selecting chats, making them easier to reach. It should also clarify which chats are selected or unselected in a group, which was previously confusing with Material You shading. Phone screens seem to be always getting larger, and that makes one-handed usability of the latest flagships tricky. Many Google apps use hamburger menus near the top of the screen to grant access to key buttons and features. This becomes a problem when youâ€™re trying to wield a modern Android phone with one hand, but Google appears to be simplifying things for at least one of its apps. Google Messages looks to be adding a new context menu that would let users access important features from anywhere in the chat. Cover screen advertisements are scheduled to start showing up next week or later. Youâ€™ll have the option to dismiss these advertisements or turn the widget off. title: Google rolls out Gemini-based health coach preview for Fitbit and Pixel Watch
summary: Android users can start testing the newest Fitbit experience starting tomorrow.
body: TL;DR Googleâ€™s Gemini-powered Fitbit Personal Health Coach lands as a public preview on October 28. The preview is available for Fitbit Premium users with a Pixel Watch or Fitbit device (Android first). The tool offers AI-driven guidance on fitness, sleep, and health through a chat interface. Google is officially putting health-focused AI to work on usersâ€™ wrists. Beginning October 28, the company will open a public preview of its Gemini-powered Fitbit Personal Health Coach for Fitbit Premium users in the US. The feature was first announced in August, when Google launched the Pixel Watch 4 . It uses Geminiâ€™s conversational smarts to blend fitness training, sleep analysis, and general health advice into a single chat-based experience. Rather than simply a new feature, the rollout represents a test drive of Googleâ€™s broader vision of personalized wellness, coinciding with a complete Fitbit app overhaul. The appâ€™s redesigned interface divides everything into four tabs: Today, Fitness, Sleep, and Health , and shifts the focus from daily streaks to long-term progress. Users can zoom out to view weekly trends, customize â€œFocus Metrics,â€ and move seamlessly between activity, recovery, anâ€¦

The idea is to leverage AI and Gemini models to give you a personal coach, just like how athletes have a team around them pâ€¦

title: Google fixes one of the Clock appâ€™s most confusing redesigns
summary: Google Clock is solving its wallpaper problem.
body: TL;DR Clock is dialing back its support for wallpaper backgrounds, to make sure you can still read the time. Googleâ€™s also beginning to remove references from Assistant within the app. Going forward, we may see a new â€œpulsingâ€ effect for the time. These past few months have been busy ones for many of Googleâ€™s Android apps, as the company has been sprucing up their looks with a fresh touch of Material 3 Expressive . While weâ€™ve generally been fans of the changes, not every swing in this Expressive direction is going to be a hit. And even though we saw Google take a very slow, measured approach to deploying these updates, some of those less-than-successful tweaks have managed to slip through to public releases. The good news is that Google is learning from your feedback, and already appears to be correcting just such an oversight. title: Google Home is hallucinating fictional identities
summary: In time for Halloween, Google Home seems to be inexplicably making up user names and events.
body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority TL;DR Google Home users report their cameras describing fictional people. One summary said â€œMichael was seen taking out the trash,â€ while another labeled a man living alone as â€œSarah.â€ If the reports are accurate, a likely possibility is that Gemini on Google Home is hallucinating, rather than intruders or data mix-ups. With Halloween week upon us, it probably isnâ€™t the best time for your smart home to start suggesting that people you arenâ€™t familiar with have been wandering your property. However, a couple of Reddit users claim their Google Home devices have started describing people they donâ€™t know. According to a post on the r/googlehome subreddit , a userâ€™s Nest camera described an activity summary saying â€œMichael was seen taking out the trash,â€ even though no one by that name lives there. When the user asked about it, Googleâ€™s assistant reportedly replied that its camera â€œcan identify faces even if you havenâ€™t explicitly named them,â€ and that it had spotted â€œMichaelâ€ between October 26 and 27. The user said theyâ€™d never entered that name into the system, but the actions described were what he himself had done. He found the response â€¦

title: One UI 8 update is back on track for Galaxy S23 and S24
summary: Distribution of Android 16-based One UI 8 was paused for Galaxy S23 and S24 phones earlier this month.
body: TL;DR The rollout of One UI 8 on Galaxy S23 and S24 has reportedly resumed in Korea. One UI 8 is reaching those phones in the October monthly update. We havenâ€™t seen the update in the US yet. Samsungâ€™s latest One UI 8 update got off to a shaky start. Since the software started rolling out in September, the company has paused distribution of its version of Android 16 on several of its phones . Now, though, it looks like the update is back on track on Galaxy S23 and S24. On Twitter, Tarun Vats has shared screenshots that show the Galaxy S23 and S24 series are once again able to download One UI 8 in South Korea. That should mean that the update will resume soon in other affected regions, as well.

title: This liquid-cooled gaming handheld is all set to blow away the competition
summary: A massive 8-inch VRR display and an absurd amount of power make this the ultimate gaming handheld.
body: TL;DR The OneXFly Apex is a new premium Windows gaming handheld from One Netbook. It features an AMD Ryzen AI Max+ 395, an 8-inch 120Hz VRR display, and an 85Wh external battery. More details will be revealed in a livestream tomorrow morning, but it wonâ€™t be cheap. While traditional Windows gaming handhelds, such as the ASUS ROG Xbox Ally , appear to be struggling with their releases, a new category of ultra-powerful handhelds has been surprisingly popular. The first was the GPD Win 5, which took the battery outside of the handheld and paired it with an unprecedented level of power in the AMD Ryzen AI Max+ 395. Now, another handheld is following suit, and it truly ups the ante. The OneXFly Apex is an upcoming handheld with a massive 8-inch 120Hz VRR display, even larger than the 7-inch display on the GPD Win 5. This could be the same IPS display used on the MSI Claw 8 AI+ and Legion Go S. We loved the display in our review of the Legion Go S , although itâ€™s not as premium as the 8.8-inch OLED panel in the upcoming Legion Go 2 .

title: OnePlus 15 is here: One step forward, two steps back, but still better than your Galaxy
summary: The OnePlus 15 brings some great upgrades, along with some potential sidegrades or even downgrades.
body: Credit: OnePlus TL;DR OnePlus has launched the OnePlus 15 in China today. The new phone has a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip, a huge 7,300mAh battery, and fast wired/wireless charging. The phone also loses Hasselblad branding, while the camera hardware could be a sidegrade. OnePlus has been teasing the OnePlus 15 for weeks ahead of its launch event, revealing battery info, some camera details, and more. Thankfully, the wait for a full reveal is over, as OnePlus has just launched the device in China today. Weâ€™ve already seen the phoneâ€™s design, featuring flat edges with curved corners and a redesigned rear camera bump. OnePlus says the phone also has IP69 and IP69K ratings, which are overkill but still welcome after years of IP rating disappointment. Take a closer look at the left edge of the phone, and youâ€™ll see a remappable shortcut button in lieu of the trademark alert slider. Thatâ€™s a significant move after years of OnePlus flagships using the slider key (with the exception of the OnePlus 10T). Nevertheless, this shortcut key can be used for ringing profiles, AI functionality, taking screenshots, and more.

title: Survey reveals OnePlus 15 is about to eat Galaxy S26â€™s lunch
summary: Galaxy fatigue seems to be setting in, and OnePlus is ready to steal the spotlight.
body: Credit: OnePlus Chinese smartphone brands are really turning up the heat this year. Weâ€™ve already seen pretty powerful and interesting launches like the Redmi K90 Pro Max , the vivo X300 series , and the Xiaomi 17 lineup. Now, OnePlus has entered the arena with the OnePlus 15.

title: More of Samsungâ€™s top selling phones are getting One UI 8 in the US
summary: Despite recent hiccups in the release for older flagships.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR One UI 8, based on Android 16, is rolling out to Galaxy A54 in the US. The update also brings Septemberâ€™s security patch. Along with the Galaxy A54, the Galaxy A15 5G has also been updated with One UI 8 in the US and Canada. Samsung has rolled out the stable One UI 8 update for countless flagships and mid-rangers. While the Android 16-based update had to be withdrawn for some older flagships , these hiccups arenâ€™t stopping it from releasing it for devices further down the line. Today, weâ€™re learning about the stable One UI 8 for the Galaxy A54 â€” which was among of the best selling 5G Android phone of 2023 . While the mid-ranger from 2023 already started receiving the One UI 8 update a few weeks ago in regions such as Korea and India, itâ€™s now also available for folks in the US.

title: Why Edge Panels are my secret weapon for multitasking on Samsung phones
summary: Android multitasking just isn't the same without Edge Panels.
body: Android has a robust multitasking system, and Iâ€™ve used split-screen and pop-up windows every day since the features were introduced. Now that Iâ€™m using a Pixel 10 Pro instead of a Samsung phone, Iâ€™ve noticed that I use split-screen less often. Why? Ever since Samsung added Edge Panels to its software over a decade ago, itâ€™s been my secret weapon for slick Android multitasking, and I miss it whenever I use a phone that doesnâ€™t have it.

title: Retroid just surprised us with two gaming handhelds, and they might be value kings
summary: It's a competitive market, but one of these devices is the first of its kind.
body: TL;DR Retroid has announced two handhelds, the Pocket G2 and the Pocket 6. The former is the first device with a Snapdragon G2 Gen 2 SoC, with the latter sporting a G2 Gen 2. The Pocket G2 launches soon at $199 for the first two weeks, with the Pocket 6 launching at a later date. There has been a flurry of new Android gaming handheld releases over the past few months, and today, Retroid finally joined the action. The company announced its highly anticipated follow-up to the Retriod Pocket 5, as well as a surprising new handheld that might end up being a better buy. The surprise handheld here is the Pocket G2, which is the first gaming handheld to ship with Qualcommâ€™s mid-range Snapdragon G2 Gen 2 chipset. Designed specifically for gaming handhelds, it should have more power and better sustained performance than Retroidâ€™s previous flagship. The company claims itâ€™s â€œalmost 2x faster than the Retroid Pocket 5,â€ which has the aging Snapdragon 865.

title: Nothing just teased a new phone that my not be â€˜newâ€™ at all
summary: And, it is bringing back the notification LED in ways no one asked for.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Nothing has teased the Phone (3a) Lite, set to launch later this week. The Phone (3a) Lite is expected to be a downgrade from the regular Phone (3a) and Phone (3a) Pro. While Nothing is teasing it as a new phone, a prominent leaker says it may just be an existing phone with minor changes. The fourth and final member of Nothingâ€™s Phone (3) series has been speculated for a while. And in no time, it is set to be a reality with a global launch slated for this week. Nothing has just confirmed it will launch a new phone in a few daysâ€™ time, i.e., on October 29. As previously rumored, this is the Nothing Phone (3a) Lite, where the suffix presumably hints that this is an inferior version of the Phone (3a) and Phone (3a) Pro launched earlier this year.

title: I refuse to install ChatGPTâ€™s new web browser, and you shoudnâ€™t switch from Chrome either
summary: Google might be the sole voice of reason in the AI browser race.
body: Credit: Dhruv Bhutani / Android Authority Would you trust an AI chatbot like ChatGPT or Gemini with your emails, financial data, or even browsing habits and data? Most of us would probably answer no to that question, and yet thatâ€™s exactly what companies like OpenAI and Perplexity are asking us to do with their new AI browsers, Atlas and Comet . OpenAIâ€™s Atlas is a new browser with ChatGPT built-in, and it goes much further than Googleâ€™s addition of Gemini to Chrome. Atlas has agentic capabilities meaning the AI can surf the internet on your behalf by opening tabs, navigating to specific websites, clicking on buttons, and even filling in text fields. If that sounds like a potential game-changer, Iâ€™d like to temper that excitement because itâ€™s also a big security gamble. Hereâ€™s why Iâ€™m not switching to Atlas in a hurry.

title: I used to hate the Pixel Tablet, but now I kind of love it
summary: Perhaps I treated you too harshly.
body: I donâ€™t know if thereâ€™s ever been a Pixel more disappointing than the Google Pixel Tablet. I reviewed the Pixel Tablet for another publication in 2023 and, at the time, called it â€œ the worst Pixel Iâ€™ve ever used â€ â€” thanks to its lackluster specs, poor design choices, and messy software. I stopped using the Pixel Tablet in December 2023, and for all of 2024 and most of 2025, it was boxed up and stored in my parentsâ€™ basement. But about a month ago, I decided to dig out the Pixel Tablet and put it back in my apartment. And â€¦ I kind of love it.

title: Samsungâ€™s tri-fold may launch very soon, but miss a key market
summary: And its expected $2,800 price tag is likely to blame.
body: TL;DR Samsung is expected to unveil its tri-fold foldable later this week at a business summit in Korea. The phone may be initially limited to Asian markets â€” particularly South Korea, China, Singapore, and Taiwan. Despite previous reports of a launch in the US, Samsung may choose not to launch it beyond the â€œGreater Chinaâ€ region. 2025 appears to be the year of new products from Samsung. After experimenting with the Galaxy S25 Edge earlier this year, Samsung released its first XR (extended reality) headset earlier this month. Very soon, it may unveil its most hyped device of the year in the form of the triple-folding smartphone. And, as per recent reports, we may not have to wait much longer to witness this new marvel. As per industry sources, Samsungâ€™s tri-fold is set to make its official appearance as early as this week. The Korea Herald reports the (supposedly named) Galaxy Z TriFold will be unveiled at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) CEO summit, scheduled to take place in the Gyeongju province in South Korea.

title: ARMSX2, the future of PS2 emulation on Android, gets first big release
summary: The app will also get a Play Store release this week.
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR The ARMSX2 emulator for Android has just received its V1.0 release on GitHub, with a Play Store release coming later this week. The app differs from NetherSX2 due to its open-source nature and its use of a more recent foundation. NetherSX2 still offers better performance, though, while this ARMSX2 release had a major bug for some. PS2 emulation on Android has been in a strange place since the pioneering AetherSX2 app was abandoned. Some developers took over this shuttered project and made impressive changes to it (resulting in NetherSX2), but the somewhat closed nature and aging foundation suggest this isnâ€™t a long-term solution. Fortunately, the ARMSX2 emulator has been in testing for a while, and itâ€™s finally received a version 1.0 release. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

Seemingly, the only way to really fix it involves disabling a feature called Doze. Fresh reports from Pixel 10 users suggest that Googleâ€™s notification woes arenâ€™t going anywhere. Users on Reddit say their new phones are struggling with severely delayed Google Home alerts, with some claiming that notifications only come in after unlocking the device.

title: This Gmail tool proved to be my best digital detox ever
summary: Google just made email decluttering effortless â€” mostly.
body: If youâ€™d ask me to find an apt analogy for my Gmail accounts, Iâ€™d equate them with junkyards â€” heaps of trash that no one wants to touch or sort. And those heaps are only spreading wider and growing taller with new junk thrown on top every single day. Thatâ€™s exactly the kind of clutter my Gmail accounts have hoarded over the years, with my email addresses ending up in hundreds, if not thousands, of mailing lists, without or with forced consent. That sneaky little checkbox that doesnâ€™t let you proceed unless you click it? Yeah, thatâ€™s the culprit. And I know Iâ€™m not alone in this boat.

body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NwprZBQj3zA After testing out popular Android emulators on the Pixel 10 Pro XL and last yearâ€™s Pixel 9 Pro XL, I came away disappointed. Performance is notably worse on the new model, making some games far less enjoyable and others outright impossible to play. The Tensor G5 processorâ€™s switch to an Imagination Technologies DXT-48-1536 graphics unit seems like a real step backward. Trying to emulate classic consoles â€” especially the 3D ones â€” is always a difficult ask, but what about games built specifically for Android? Well, I tested those too, and once again, the results are a mixed bag for Googleâ€™s latest flagship.

title: Keep track of your ticker! These are the best heart rate monitors Iâ€™ve tested in 2025
summary: Accuracy is the key to my heart (rate tracking).
body: Heart rate is a key metric for tracking health and fitness, and thanks to smartwatches and fitness trackers with built-in sensors, monitoring it is easier than ever. As Android Authority â€™s wearables expert, Iâ€™ve tested countless heart rate monitors over the years, from chest straps to wrist-based trackers, evaluating everything from accuracy to comfort. Some offer focused, high-quality heart rate data, while others deliver more versatile, all-in-one tracking. Below are my top recommendations. Google Pixel Watch 4: The best heart rate monitoring smartwatch The Google Pixel Watch 3 impressed me with how accurately it tracks heart rate, and I was eager to see if the newest model would hold up. After reviewing the Pixel Watch 4 , I can confirm itâ€™s easily one of the most precise wrist-based monitors Iâ€™ve tested. It consistently delivers readings that match my dedicated chest straps, which are considered the gold standard for heart rate tracking. That level of accuracy makes the Pixel Watch 4 one of the most reliable heart rate monitors Iâ€™ve worn in any form. Plus, the device is backed by Fitbitâ€™s robust health platform and Googleâ€™s improved algorithms, for a well-rounded, reliable exâ€¦

It seemed to spark the imagination of several readers who, in turn, suggested their favorite apps in the comments section. I always love it when you contribute to our community! Since Iâ€™m always up for trying new apps and evaluating my current loadout, I gave each some of my time. I have used some of the apps mentioned before, while some remain a firm part of my team. I decided not to include these in the list below. However, these are the less common apps I found genuinely interesting and will likely add to my growing app collection. Stellarium

title: This sneaky phone hack saved me a ton of money on my kidâ€™s first Android phone
summary: Prepaid carriers are your best friend for cheap phones.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority Earlier this year, I decided to get my son his first phone as he was entering middle school. I wanted something affordable, reasonably durable, and not so underpowered that it would feel sluggish. I strongly considered buying a phone unlocked outright , but even the cheapest options were well over $100 unless I wanted nothing more than a glorified paperweight. Considering some kids are less great with phones than others, I really didnâ€™t want to spend much here at all. Thatâ€™s when I decided to try another path: buying a prepaid phone at a discount.

title: I use YouTube daily and the new video UI is driving me nuts
summary: Google, this is bad.
body: Like many of you reading this, I use YouTube multiple times per day. And for the past week, anytime Iâ€™ve watched YouTube on my computer, Iâ€™ve been distracted by the terrible, horrible, no good, very bad new UI. Last Tuesday, Google announced a series of significant visual changes for YouTube , the most prominent being a redesigned video player. Some people have had access to it for a couple of months, but itâ€™s now officially available to the masses, and Iâ€™ve been living with it for a little over a week. And, simply put, I really donâ€™t like it.

title: If the Galaxy S26 leaks are true, Iâ€™d tell small phone fans to buy this instead
summary: Who says smaller flagship phones should make major hardware sacrifices?
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority I was cautiously optimistic when I heard that Samsung might overhaul its Galaxy S26 series lineup. What especially caught my eye was evidence that Samsung was planning to launch a Galaxy S26 Pro in place of the expected Galaxy S26. The name alone suggested that we were looking at a more feature-packed base model. That would be a long-overdue move as the base Galaxy S flagship has always been small yet bereft of upgrades. Unfortunately, spec leaks point to anything but a Pro handset. Furthermore, a recent leak also suggests that the entry-level model will revert to the standard Galaxy S26 name rather than the Pro moniker.

title: My browserâ€™s best productivity hack was hiding right under my nose
summary: No extensions or workarounds needed â€” the feature is built right in.
body: There are a variety of ways I have been trying to improve my productivity on my browser, especially after making the switch away from Chrome . Iâ€™ve tried read-it-later apps, a new approach to bookmarks, and some useful extensions. But recently, I discovered a tool thatâ€™s not only already built into browsers like Chrome and Brave but is also simple enough to fit seamlessly into my workflow. This feature is called custom search shortcuts, and it has been hiding under my nose for years.

title: Google Chrome is the worst browser for non-techies â€” hereâ€™s why
summary: It's not an awful browser, but there are better options if you can't skirt its shortcomings.
body: The obvious or easiest option isnâ€™t always the best, and this is especially true when it comes to Android apps . Many users swear by Google Chrome on their phones and while some genuinely appreciate its functionality and design, most non-techies use it because itâ€™s preinstalled and immediately available. Sure, thatâ€™s a fair reason, but I donâ€™t believe Chrome is the best browser for those not well-versed in online security and digital hygiene. You might like Chrome, but itâ€™s not for everyone

title: Google is working on another huge multitasking upgrade for Android tablets
summary: Google may be working on a feature that will let tablet users put any Android app in a floating bubble.
body: Over the past few years, Google has made major changes to the Android OS to better accommodate tablets and other large-screen devices. These include new features like a taskbar, desktop windowing, enhanced drag-and-drop support, improved app adaptability, and more. Despite these improvements, most people would agree that Android tablets still have a long way to go before they can replace PCs, largely because of their limited multitasking capabilities. Thankfully, we know that Google is working to improve Androidâ€™s multitasking capabilities. The company is making big changes to the platform in preparation for Android-powered PCs , and these changes will benefit not only future Android PCs but also existing Android tablets. One such change Google has been exploring is the ability to launch any Android app in a floating bubble, taking a niche feature currently reserved for messaging apps and turning it into a powerful, general-purpose multitasking feature.

title: We tested the best dual-SIM Android phones, and these are the ones you should buy in 2025
summary: Almost every new Android phone packs dual-SIM capabilities, but these are the products that impressed us the most.
body: Iâ€™ve tested a dizzying number of dual-SIM Android phones in my time, and even thatâ€™s a fraction of our collective knowledge at Android Authority . The best devices never sit on their perch for long before a new pretender to the crown comes along to usurp it. This makes it an exciting and ever-changing field you must keep abreast of. title: I wanted to buy a Nest Cam but got this cheap alternative instead â€” hereâ€™s why
summary: Not only is it cheaper, it's also better in more ways than one.
body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority I moved into my new apartment a few months ago and wanted to set up a security camera for obvious reasons. The crime rate is going up, so I feel more comfortable knowing Iâ€™ll get a notification if someone walks into my home when Iâ€™m not there. I also generally like to check the live feed every now and then, making sure there arenâ€™t any other issues while Iâ€™m away. My first impulse was to buy an indoor Nest Cam (3rd gen) . Iâ€™m already deep into Googleâ€™s ecosystem, using everything from Gmail and NotebookLM , to Photos and even Gemini . I also have a Pixel phone. I like Googleâ€™s products in general, so a Nest Cam seemed like the obvious choice.

title: Google needs to rethink its foldable Pixel phones
summary: The Pixel 10 Pro Fold proves that Google's current strategy isn't working.
body: I recently wrapped up my review of the Google Pixel 10 Pro Fold , and itâ€™s a phone I found immensely frustrating. As a longtime Pixel user and a fan of folding phones, Iâ€™m the target audience for Googleâ€™s latest foldable. Googleâ€™s Pixel UI, exclusive software features, and reliable cameras in a folding form factor? That should be an easy win. Last year, it largely was. The year-over-year jump Google made from the first Pixel Fold to the Pixel 9 Pro Fold is still hard to believe to this very day. And compared to other foldables released in 2024, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold stood out as something special .

title: I tried switching an eSIM from my Android phone, and it was still a nightmare
summary: Switching a physical SIM takes seconds, why do I need to call Verizon for an eSIM?
body: Iâ€™m no longer surprised when something disappears from a new phone. I watched removable batteries and headphone jacks disappear, and I didnâ€™t really blink because theyâ€™d already been replaced by quicker charging and more reliable Bluetooth headphones. Now, though, the SIM tray has become an endangered species, and Iâ€™m worried about growing pains. It still exists on Samsungâ€™s Galaxy series and all of Motorolaâ€™s latest launches, but Apple and Google have started leaving it behind. As a reviewer, itâ€™s starting to cause me all kinds of headaches, and something needs to change.

title: Iâ€™ll admit it, I was wrong about Metro by T-Mobile
summary: Metro is a much better service than I previously realized.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority While Iâ€™ve used T-Mobile-based prepaid brands in the past, Iâ€™ve generally favored AT&T or Verizon-based networks, since the area where I live has historically had poor T-Mobile performance. Recently, I learned that T-Mobileâ€™s service had improved locally, so I decided to test it out for myself. One of the first options I picked up was Metro by T-Mobile , mainly because Iâ€™d never really had any firsthand experience with it. Previously, my impression of Metro was that it was a lot like Total and Cricket, only somewhat worse. After all, Total and Cricket are similarly priced, and yet they at least offer higher-priority data on their more expensive plans. Iâ€™ve now come to realize that much of my earlier impression had more to do with T-Mobileâ€™s performance in my area than with any real failing on Metroâ€™s part. Simply put, I was wrong about Metro by T-Mobile.

title: YouTube TV is sparring with Disney, and youâ€™re about to pay for it
summary: Disney channels could soon disappear from YouTube TV if deal isnâ€™t reached.
body: TL;DR YouTube TVâ€™s deal with Disney, which includes content from ABC and ESPN, is up for renewal. If YouTube TV and Disney canâ€™t come to an agreement before the end of October 30, subscribers will face a blackout. Google successfully managed talks with NBCUniversal, Fox, and Paramount previously in 2025. YouTube TV is a popular live TV streaming service that helps subscribers cut the cord, but itâ€™s struggling to keep legacy channels on board. It wrangled with NBCUniversal earlier this month, and had similar public battles with Fox and Paramount over distribution rights in 2025. Now, YouTube TV is undergoing similar negotiations with Disney. Google this week announced it is negotiating with Disney to keep networks like ESPN and ABC available on YouTube TV. The companyâ€™s current distribution deal expires on October 30 at 11:59 PM ET, and both sides are warning of a blackout if a â€œfair dealâ€ isnâ€™t reached.

title: First look: Googleâ€™s new â€˜EyeDropperâ€™ app will help you pick colors in Android 17
summary: Android 17 could bring an â€œEyeDropperâ€ tool that helps you determine the colors being used in an image.
body: TL;DR Google is developing a native color picker tool called â€œEyeDropperâ€ that is expected to be released with Android 17. This new app will provide a system-wide API, allowing any app to let users select a specific color from their screen and get its value. The tool is designed for both touchscreens and desktop modes, with logic to handle multiple displays when a mouse and keyboard are detected. For professionals who work with images and videos, knowing the exact colors theyâ€™re dealing with is critical. Eyeballing it isnâ€™t always enough, as many jobs require precise color reproduction. Thatâ€™s why hexadecimal codes are often used to represent colors, providing a standard way to accurately replicate them across different software. While most professional apps and web browsers have built-in color pickers that can grab these codes, Android currently lacks this feature. That could change in next yearâ€™s Android 17 release, though. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. Wyze has added another smart home device to its growing lineup, this time with a budget-friendly option for the front door. The new Wyze Battery Video Doorbell is now available for $65.98, offering flexible installation, a wide 150-degree x 150-degree view, and up to six months of battery life between charges. title: OpenAIâ€™s Atlas browser has a security flaw that could expose your private info
summary: OpenAI Atlas drops the ball on security.
body: Credit: Dhruv Bhutani / Android Authority TL;DR OpenAIâ€™s recently launched browser, Atlas, has a concerning vulnerability. Atlas appears to be susceptible to attacks known as clipboard injections. This type of attack can be used to steal login credentials, credit card numbers, and other sensitive data. The company best known for ChatGPT, OpenAI, surprised us earlier this week by dropping its new AI-powered browser, Atlas . And since its debut, it appears to be the talk of the town, as we see from Google Trends for keyword searches of popular agentic browsers. Before you go and try it for yourself, you should know that it appears to have a serious security flaw. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google says Pixel 10 Pro Fold battery confusion caused by â€˜incompatibleâ€™ chargers (Update)
summary: Google recommends a reboot and using certified chargers.
body: TL;DR Several reports have surfaced of Pixel 10 Pro Fold phones failing to report battery status, instead showing a ? icon. Google says the issue is caused by using â€œincompatibleâ€ wireless chargers. A reboot should fix the issue, Google says. Itâ€™s recommended Pixel 10 owners use certified Qi2 wireless chargers. Update, October 24, 2025 (11:58 AM ET): A Google spokesperson tells Android Authority that this issue is â€œcaused by using an incompatible wireless charger,â€ and that a reboot will typically fix it. The spokesperson also said that this behavior will be fixed in an update rolling out next month. Google recommends using certified Qi2 wireless chargers with its phones. If youâ€™re still seeing a question mark next to your battery indicator after rebooting your phone, contact Google support. Original article, October 23, 2025 (12:02 PM ET): The Pixel 10 Pro Fold was released just a couple of weeks ago, and as it often goes, problems are cropping up now that itâ€™s in the wild. Namely, multiple users are reporting an unexplained battery issue that might require a warranty claim.

title: Maldives becomes the first country to achieve â€˜triple eliminationâ€™ of mother-to-child transmission of HIV, syphilis and hepatitis B
summary: In a landmark public health achievement, the World Health Organization (WHO) has validated the Maldives for eliminating mother-to-child transmission (EMTCT) of hepatitis B, while maintaining its earlier validation (in 2019) for EMTCT of HIV and syphilis.

title: WHO warns of widespread resistance to common antibiotics worldwide

summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today released a new report titled â€œSaving lives, spending lessâ€, revealing that an additional investment of just US$3 per person annually in tackling noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) could yield economic benefits of up to US$1 trillion by 2030.

summary: The global cholera statistics for 2024, shows an increase in both the number of people who fell sick and died from the disease.
